results.title: Acting class
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Kroitor and John Smith
results.brief_description: For anyone who has ever wondered what it takes to become an actor, the film provides a close-up of a craft that demands much from body and mind. An energetic and intense film which looks in at students and instructors as they sweat and strain through a typical workday at the National Theatre School - Canada’s foremost training ground for performers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Roman Kroitor and John Smith

results.title: Act of no choice
results.creator_credit: Kino Eye Pictures and Mark Worth
results.brief_description: This video tells the tragic story of West Papua through the eyes of Arie Van Klinken : a Dutch patrol officer in the 50s and 60s ; William Zongannau: a prominent West Papuan politician in the 1960s ; and Hugh Lunn: the only living journalist who witnessed the farcical ‘Act of Free Choice” for West Papua in 1969. Through access to secret documents, the film uncovers how Australia colluded with Indonesia to keep the so called “Act of Free Choice” a secret from the outside world. Contains Dutch home movies, newsreel footage and previously unseen film coverage of the “Act of Free Choice”. Music by David Bridie and Arthur Lyman.

results.title: Across the Antarctica: a transatlantic view
results.brief_description: In an interview with Robert Mackenzie two members of the Commonwealth Trans-Antarctic Expedition - the leader Dr. Vivian Fuchs and Sir Edmund Hillary, in charge of the New Zealand party - discuss details of the plans for crossing the Antarctic Continent during 1955/58.

results.title: Across Canada with Princess Elizabeth
results.brief_description: A memorable record of the 15,000 mile tour of Canada by Princess Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh. Opening with the Royal couple’s tumultuous reception in Quebec, the film covers the full extent of the tour. Narrated by Bernard Braden and Barbera Kelly.

results.title: Acrobats of God (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: H Poindexter, Martha Graham Centre for Contemporary Dance and Dave Wilson

results.title: Acoustic behaviour of the grey kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Australian National University and Ross Christopher
results.brief_description: Looks at the work done at the Acoustic Laboratory of the research School of Biological Sciences at the Australian National University on senses in kangaroos. Shows the environment of the kangaroo and how its hearing is used in cooperation with its eyes for scanning.

results.title: acousma
results.brief_description: It uses as its basis recordings of the electrical activity occuring within my brain during unconsciousness, to create a unique sound composition, a kind of audio representation of my dreams during sleep. This we realised through the use of software to systematically create audio transcriptions of both my EEG (electroencephalography) wave-traces and MRI images into sound, subsequently giving my unconscious mind a voice. The visual element of the piece consists of the entire sequence of MRI scans which were used in creating the soundtrack. These I animated in order that the viewer be taken on a highly unorthodox journey through the human head, as part of the experience

results.title: Acne...it's not your fault
results.brief_description: Outlines the various types of acne suffered by adolescents ranging from a few spots to severe inflamation and indicates the treatment required for each of these stages of acne severity. Stresses that bad acne needs treatment by a medical practitioner.
